00:00:04:110000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:00:04:110000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:00:05:110000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:00:05:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:05:110000.Dialogue: Oh, uh, Priya's calling in a few minutes on Skype, and we are gonna have a dinner date.

00:00:12:000000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:00:12:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:12:000000.Dialogue: It's 8:00 in the morning in Mumbai. How can she have dinner?

00:00:16:150000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:00:16:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:16:150000.Dialogue: Fine, whatever. Priya will be having breakfast.

00:00:19:020000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:00:19:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:19:020000.Dialogue: All right, so technically it's not a dinner date. I suppose you could call it a, uh, dinfast date. But if you did, you'd open yourself to peer-based mocking, such as, Hey, Leonard, how was your dinfast with Priya last night?

00:00:33:050000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:00:33:050000.Speaker: Leonard

00:00:35:030000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:00:35:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:35:030000.Dialogue: You didn't let me finish. Dinfast.

00:00:39:020000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:00:39:020000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:00:41:040000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:00:41:040000.Speaker: Leonard

00:00:42:170000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:00:42:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:42:170000.Dialogue: Paraffin candles may contain carcinogens. Unless lung cancer is the ambiance you were going for at your dinfast.

00:00:51:040000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:00:51:040000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:00:53:150000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:00:53:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:53:150000.Dialogue: Listen, I don't want to be rude, but Priya's gonna be calling any minute, so...

00:00:57:070000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:00:57:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:57:070000.Dialogue: Oh, yes, Priya. Leonard, you know I make a point of never interfering in your personal affairs.

00:01:08:080000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:01:08:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:08:080000.Dialogue: Yes, I've always admired that about you.

00:01:11:030000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:01:11:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:11:030000.Dialogue: As well you should. But I'm going to make an exception here.

00:01:14:200000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:01:14:200000.Speaker: Leonard

00:01:16:120000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:01:16:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:16:120000.Dialogue: Priya has moved back to India to pursue her law career. Instead of desperately trying to keep this intercontinental relationship alive, you could use that time to take up a hobby.

00:01:30:170000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:01:30:170000.Speaker: Leonard

00:01:33:010000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:01:33:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:33:010000.Dialogue: Yes. I read recently about a fellow in Kansas with an enormous ball of twine.

00:01:42:010000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:01:42:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:42:010000.Dialogue: I bet you could give him a run for his money.

00:01:45:030000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:01:45:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:45:030000.Dialogue: You know, some people might say that it's great that we're trying to make things work long distance. They'd say things like, Love is stronger than the miles between you

00:01:54:210000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:01:54:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:54:210000.Dialogue: When I rise to power, those people will be sterilized.

00:01:59:150000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:01:59:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:59:150000.Dialogue: You video-chat with Amy all the time. How is this different?

00:02:04:030000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:02:04:030000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:02:05:150000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:02:05:150000.Speaker: Leonard

00:02:07:100000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:02:07:100000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:02:11:220000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:02:11:220000.Speaker: Leonard

00:02:14:060000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:02:14:060000.Speaker: Priya

00:02:15:110000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:02:15:110000.Speaker: Leonard

00:02:16:110000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:02:16:110000.Speaker: Priya

00:02:17:150000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:02:17:150000.Speaker: Leonard

00:02:18:200000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
00:02:18:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:18:200000.Dialogue: I miss the old days when your romantic partners could be returned to the video store.

00:02:26:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:26:060000.Dialogue: Thanks for letting me stay here while Leonard Skypes with his girlfriend.

00:02:30:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:30:100000.Dialogue: Oh, it's no problem. It's actually kind of nice. You reading, me reading. We're like an old married couple.

00:02:38:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:38:030000.Dialogue: If we were an old married couple, the wife would serve iced tea and snickerdoodles.

00:02:44:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:44:020000.Dialogue: I don't have iced tea and snickerdoodles.

00:02:48:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:48:190000.Dialogue: A good wife would go to the store.

00:02:55:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:55:150000.Dialogue: Good. On the way to see the lawyer, pick up some tea and cookies.

00:03:03:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:03:140000.Dialogue: I must say, I am enjoying your new chair.

00:03:08:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:08:150000.Dialogue: It is. Aligns the lumbar, cradles the coccyx, balances the buttocks. This is a chair worthy of the name.

00:03:22:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:22:230000.Dialogue: Oh, all right, well, I'm glad you like it. I mean, I still can't get over the fact someone just threw it away.

00:03:31:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:31:090000.Dialogue: Yeah, it was just sitting on the street. I paid a homeless guy ten bucks to help me get it up here.

00:03:47:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:47:130000.Dialogue: You take it easy! I need to use your shower.

00:03:52:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:52:030000.Dialogue: I went into this marriage with so much hope.

00:03:57:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:57:050000.Dialogue: There's a wet Band-Aid on the shower floor!

00:04:32:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:32:140000.Dialogue: This is fun. I've never used a hydraulic thermoforming press before.

00:04:37:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:37:080000.Dialogue: Pretty sweet, huh? This little baby set the university back 175 grand.

00:04:42:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:42:140000.Dialogue: That's three minutes. Should we see what we got?

00:04:46:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:46:200000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah. This is one good-looking panini.

00:04:59:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:59:030000.Dialogue: How's it going with the long-distance love affair?

00:05:02:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:02:110000.Dialogue: Not easy, but we're making it work.

00:05:06:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:06:210000.Dialogue: When you say "making it work," does that include doing the cyber nasty?

00:05:13:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:13:050000.Dialogue: You know, the virtual pickle tickle.

00:05:20:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:20:010000.Dialogue: Come on, dude. This is my sister you're talking about.

00:05:23:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:23:170000.Dialogue: Hey, Leonard jiggling his junk at her through a webcam has got to be easier for you to deal with than him actually touching her with it.

00:05:31:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:31:160000.Dialogue: There's no junk jiggling. We just talk.

00:05:34:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:34:120000.Dialogue: Are you sane? With high-speed Internet, you have at your fingertips the greatest advancement in the field of sex since the invention of the washcloth.

00:05:46:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:46:060000.Dialogue: Well, if you don't, you're gonna lose Priya to some fancy guy in a turban who grew up with Kama Sutra coloring books.

00:05:54:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:54:120000.Dialogue: How can you be so racist?

00:05:56:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:56:210000.Dialogue: Oh, come on, tell me I'm wrong.

00:06:01:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:01:020000.Dialogue: There you are. I need you to check my head for chair lice.

00:06:05:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:05:060000.Dialogue: I did it last night, I'm not doing it again.

00:06:11:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:11:190000.Dialogue: I don't want to talk about it.

00:06:16:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:16:160000.Dialogue: You didn't catch bugs from Penny's chair.

00:06:18:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:18:230000.Dialogue: Yes, I did. And now they're cavorting at the base of my hair follicles like dancing hippies at the Redwood National Forest.

00:06:26:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:26:060000.Dialogue: Sheldon, you do this all the time. You fixate on some crazy idea and then blow it way out of proportion.

00:06:33:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:33:120000.Dialogue: Name one time I've ever done that.

00:06:38:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:38:160000.Dialogue: How about when you put GPS trackers in your garbage because you were convinced North Korean spies were stealing your doodles?

00:06:46:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:46:050000.Dialogue: The chicken nuggets you were sure were human nuggets.

00:06:50:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:50:130000.Dialogue: The strangely-shaped cloud that was following you around town.

00:06:55:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:55:180000.Dialogue: The time you put on my shirt by mistake and were convinced you'd started growing again.

00:07:00:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:00:130000.Dialogue: I said, "Name one." You really need to work on your listening skills.

00:07:14:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:14:230000.Dialogue: You need to remove that chair from the building. It's a health hazard.

00:07:18:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:18:190000.Dialogue: Okay, relax. I took off the slipcovers, had them dry-cleaned and then fumigated the cushions.

00:07:24:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:24:050000.Dialogue: Yeah. It's cleaner than my couch. Found half a Hot Pocket in there.

00:07:34:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:34:110000.Dialogue: It certainly looks okay. Has a strong toxic chemical smell. That's reassuring.

00:07:42:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:42:070000.Dialogue: Why don't you give it a try, Sheldon?

00:07:58:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:58:110000.Dialogue: Why don't you just admit you overreacted?

00:08:23:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:23:040000.Dialogue: It's like living with a Chihuahua.

00:08:35:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:35:030000.Dialogue: You have to get rid of the chair.

00:08:47:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:47:030000.Dialogue: For your safety, please wait in my apartment as I call the authorities so they may remove the chair of death.

00:09:08:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:08:180000.Dialogue: Under my authority as a self-appointed member of the Centers for Disease Control street team...

00:09:20:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:20:080000.Dialogue: As a man with a keen sense of style, I must tell you, that chair does not work with the room.

00:09:48:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:48:030000.Dialogue: So, here we are. Back in bed together.

00:09:57:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:57:080000.Dialogue: Okay, so I-I guess I'll just jump right in.

00:10:09:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:09:020000.Dialogue: And-And, uh, I-I want to punish you with my love?

00:10:21:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:21:230000.Dialogue: Okay. Uh, uh, you're... not naughty. Uh, you're-you're-you're dirty.

00:10:38:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:38:150000.Dialogue: Yeah, yeah. Uh, okay. You're a, you're a...

00:10:55:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:55:130000.Dialogue: Why don't you just give me five minutes? I'll Google how to do this. I'll call you right back.

00:11:00:190000.Speaker: Priya
00:11:00:190000.Dialogue: Shh-shh-shh. Just be quiet and do what I tell you.

00:11:08:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:08:080000.Dialogue: All rightie. Shirt coming off. Ta-da! Man nipples.

00:11:23:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:23:200000.Dialogue: Taking shorts off. There we go. Naked, naked, naked!

00:11:33:060000.Speaker: Priya
00:11:33:060000.Dialogue: Wonderful. Now I'll take off my clothes.

00:11:48:090000.Speaker: Priya
00:11:48:090000.Dialogue: Here I am, baby. You miss these?

00:12:01:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:01:040000.Dialogue: The screen froze. It's probably just buffering Just give it a second.

00:12:13:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:13:100000.Dialogue: So, how are your mom and dad?

00:12:17:100000.Speaker: Priya
00:12:17:100000.Dialogue: Yeah, I really don't want to talk about my parents now.

00:12:31:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:31:120000.Dialogue: I didn't even think of that. Thanks.

00:12:33:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:33:130000.Dialogue: You're welcome. Please let me know when

00:12:35:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:35:130000.Dialogue: you and your girlfriend are done

00:12:37:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:37:020000.Dialogue: hogging the bandwidth for your self-abuse.

00:12:39:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:39:020000.Dialogue: I'm trying to stream a movie on Netflix in here.

00:12:44:120000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:12:44:120000.Speaker: Amy

00:13:08:150000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:13:08:150000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:08:150000.Dialogue: You are aware that your ritualistic knocking behavior is symptomatic of obsessive/ compulsive disorder?

00:13:12:230000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:13:12:230000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:13:15:110000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:13:15:110000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:13:18:030000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:13:18:030000.Speaker: Amy

00:13:20:120000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:13:20:120000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:13:22:090000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:13:22:090000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:22:090000.Dialogue: Would you like to hear me play a bossa nova standard on the harp?

00:13:25:190000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:13:25:190000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:13:27:160000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:13:27:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:27:160000.Dialogue: How about the theme song to the classic television show Diff'rent Strokes?

00:13:33:060000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:13:33:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:13:36:070000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:13:36:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:36:070000.Dialogue: Well, that's every song I know. What's up?

00:13:39:080000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:13:39:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:39:080000.Dialogue: You're good friends with Penny, right?

00:13:42:040000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:13:42:040000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:42:040000.Dialogue: Best friends, besties, BFFs, peas in a pod, sisters who would share traveling pants. Go on.

00:13:48:020000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:13:48:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:48:020000.Dialogue: I was hoping she might listen to you about the dangers of owning unhygienic furniture.

00:13:56:050000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:13:56:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:56:050000.Dialogue: For general educational purposes, or has she acquired a bar stool dipped in cholera?

00:14:01:080000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:14:01:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:01:080000.Dialogue: Cholera is water-borne. You're mocking me.

00:14:05:040000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:14:05:040000.Speaker: Amy

00:14:07:120000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:14:07:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:07:120000.Dialogue: Penny has dragged a chair in off the street whose unknown provenance jeopardizes the health and welfare of every resident in our building.

00:14:15:130000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:14:15:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:15:130000.Dialogue: Sheldon, just because you have a focus on cleanliness bordering on the psychotic doesn't mean I have to participate.

00:14:21:210000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:14:21:210000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:27:070000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:14:27:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:27:070000.Dialogue: Kiss me where I've never been kissed before.

00:14:31:030000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:14:31:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:31:030000.Dialogue: You mean like Salt Lake City?

00:14:36:230000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:14:36:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:36:230000.Dialogue: Never mind. I'll talk to Penny.

00:14:38:210000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:14:38:210000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:40:070000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:14:40:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:40:070000.Dialogue: Will you listen to me play my harp now?

00:14:42:120000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:14:42:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:42:120000.Dialogue: No. I dislike the sound of the harp. Its overuse in classic television sitcoms always makes me think I'm going to experience an episode from my past.

00:14:53:120000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
00:14:53:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:53:120000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, Mommy. Don't be mad at me. Don't do that!

00:15:00:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:00:160000.Dialogue: I don't know about this, Howard.

00:15:02:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:02:040000.Dialogue: What? You're having trouble with the long-distance lovemaking. This is your answer. There are two interfaces that simulate a human mouth. You have one, Priya has one in India. When you move your lips and tongue on yours, it transmits exactly what you're doing to hers. See? Internet kissing.

00:15:40:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:40:100000.Dialogue: Almost. Really get your tongue in there. to activate the motion sensor.

00:16:00:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:00:070000.Dialogue: Yeah, you got it, you got it.

00:16:04:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:04:190000.Dialogue: I'm impressed. This is very lifelike.

00:16:08:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:08:030000.Dialogue: Whoa! You just bit my tongue!

00:16:11:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:11:040000.Dialogue: I-I nibbled. I was being playful.

00:16:15:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:15:070000.Dialogue: Why do you have to make everything weird?

00:16:33:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:33:150000.Dialogue: Pretty cool, huh? Probably would cost, like, 200 bucks in a store.

00:16:38:080000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:38:080000.Dialogue: I do appreciate a bargain. This entire ensemble once belonged to my dead grandmother.

00:16:44:090000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:44:090000.Dialogue: Everything except bra and panties. And they're a leopard-spotted secret I share with Victoria.

00:16:53:150000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:53:150000.Dialogue: I just have one question about the chair.

00:16:58:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:58:170000.Dialogue: Aren't you worried about it being unhygienic?

00:17:03:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:03:130000.Dialogue: No, it's completely fine... Hmm. I get it. Sheldon sent you. He put you up to this.

00:17:13:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:13:120000.Dialogue: Yes, he did. He absolutely did.

00:17:16:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:16:110000.Dialogue: My God, Amy, that's really crappy of you.

00:17:21:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:21:090000.Dialogue: Yeah! Letting Sheldon use you to manipulate me? I thought you were my friend.

00:17:25:090000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:25:090000.Dialogue: No, I am your friend. Please don't be mad at me.

00:17:28:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:28:010000.Dialogue: I can't even believe this. You know, maybe you should just go.

00:17:30:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:30:170000.Dialogue: No! No, I'm sorry. I'm so sorry. I take it all back! Look! I'm, uh, I'm sitting in your chair. There's nothing wrong with it. It's a great chair. Please let me continue to be part of your world.

00:17:42:180000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:42:180000.Dialogue: Something in the chair's biting my tushy. It's not important. Ow!

00:17:58:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:58:180000.Dialogue: Swear you won't tell Sheldon what happened!

00:18:06:060000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:06:060000.Dialogue: Can I tell my doctor? I'm probably gonna need shots!

00:18:20:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:20:130000.Dialogue: Oh, hey, babe, I think I figured this thing out.

00:18:24:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:24:100000.Dialogue: No, you listen! You're my woman, and I'm gonna make you feel things you have never felt before.

00:18:31:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:31:180000.Dialogue: That's right, say my name... and beg me for more, 'cause... I'm gonna give it to you.

00:18:45:160000.Speaker: Dr Koothrappali
00:18:45:160000.Dialogue: Hello, Leonard... if I may also say your name.

00:18:55:150000.Scene: The street outside the apartment block.
00:18:55:150000.Speaker: Howard

00:18:57:190000.Scene: The street outside the apartment block.
00:18:57:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:57:190000.Dialogue: Yeah. Hey, you know, if this was in Sheldon and Leonard's apartment, I wouldn't wind up sitting on the floor all the time.

00:19:04:110000.Speaker: Howard

00:19:09:070000.Scene: The street outside the apartment block.
